questions.qText: In the circuit (Fig. 4.114), all symbols have their usual meanings. At \(t=0\), key \(K\) is closed. Answer the following about the equivalent resistance between terminals \(A\) and \(B\).
At \(t=0\), the equivalent resistance between \(A\) and \(B\) is
As \(t\to\infty\), the equivalent resistance between \(A\) and \(B\) is

Two different coils have self-inductances \(L_1=8\,\text{mH}\) and \(L_2=2\,\text{mH}\). The current in each coil is increased at the same constant rate. At a certain instant, the power given to the two coils is the same. At that time, the current, induced voltage and the energy stored in the first coil are \(i_1\), \(v_1\) and \(\omega_1\) respectively. The corresponding values for the second coil are \(i_2\), \(v_2\) and \(\omega_2\). Then
The potential difference across a \(2\,\text{H}\) inductor as a function of time is shown (current initially zero). Choose the correct statement(s).
qOptions: The current–time graph across the inductor is the one labelled (C) in the figure.
The current–time graph across the inductor is the one labelled (D) in the figure.

The current through the inductor at time \(t=2\,\text{s}\) is

A square frame consists of two loops with resistors and inductors as shown. The frame is placed in a time-varying magnetic field: one loop lies in a region with crosses (into the page) and the other in dots (out of the page). The magnetic field varies as \(B=(20+10t)\,\text{Wb m}^{-2}\) in both regions. Dimensions: \(l=20\,\text{cm}\), \(b=10\,\text{cm}\). The frame has \(R=10\,\Omega\) and \(L=10\,\text{H}\).
The direction of induced current in the bigger loop will be
qOptions: first clockwise for some time, then anticlockwise, and so on
first anticlockwise for some time, then clockwise, and so on

In the circuit of Fig. 4.113, switches \(S_1\) and \(S_3\) have been closed for 1 s and \(S_2\) remained open. Just after 1 s, switch \(S_2\) is closed and \(S_1\) and \(S_3\) are opened (\(t=0^+\)). Answer the following.
The maximum current in the circuit containing the inductor and capacitor (only \(S_2\) is closed) is
The maximum charge on the capacitor is
The charge on the upper plate of the capacitor as a function of time is

A pure inductor \(L\), a capacitor \(C\) and a resistor \(R\) are connected across a battery of emf \(E\) and internal resistance \(r\) as shown (switch \(S_w\) closed at \(t=0\)). Select the correct alternative(s).
qOptions: Current through \(R\) is zero all the time.
Current through \(R\) is zero at \(t=0\) and as \(t\to\infty\).
Maximum charge stored in the capacitor is \(CE\).
Maximum energy stored in the inductor equals the maximum energy stored in the capacitor.

questions.qText: A simple \(LR\) circuit is connected to a battery at \(t=0\). The energy stored in the inductor reaches half of its maximum value at time
For the circuit shown, what is the rate of change of current through the \(4\,\text{mH}\) inductor immediately after the switch is closed?

A long conductor is placed in a horizontal plane carrying current \(i(t)=3+4t^2\). A square loop (side \(0.25\,\text{m}\)) lies in the same plane at a distance \(1\,\text{m}\) from the conductor, as shown. The loop is connected to an inductor of inductance \(5\,\text{H}\). Find the current in the inductor as a function of time (assume \(t=0\) is when current starts in the straight conductor). (Options are made-up distractors; one is correct.)

In the LR–C network shown, at a certain instant the circuit current is \(1\,\text{A}\) and increasing at the rate of \(2\,\text{A s}^{-1}\). The charge on the capacitor at the same instant will be ______.
The network shown is part of a complete circuit. If at a certain instant the electric current is \(10\,\text{A}\) and is increasing at \(10^3\,\text{A s}^{-1}\), then
qOptions: If electric current is increasing at \(10^3\,\text{A s}^{-1}\), then \(V_A-V_B=0\).
If electric current is increasing at \(10^3\,\text{A s}^{-1}\), then the rate of increase of magnetic energy in one of the inductors is \(10\,\text{J s}^{-1}\).
If electric current is increasing at \(10^3\,\text{A s}^{-1}\), then the time rate of increase of the total magnetic energy stored in both inductors is \(200\,\text{J s}^{-1}\).

questions.qText: For the network shown (values: \(R_1=2\,\Omega\), \(R_2=3\,\Omega\), \(L=4\,\text{H}\), source/capacitor waveforms as marked), answer the following. Graphs labelled (a), (b), (c), (d) are provided alongside.
The current \(i_L\) through the inductor is
The variation of current in the inductor with time can be represented by the graph labelled

The variation of potential difference across \(C\) and \(D\), \(V_{CD}\), with time is represented by
In the network shown (part of a complete circuit), if at a certain instant the current is \(5\,\text{A}\) and is decreasing at a rate of \(10^3\,\text{A s}^{-1}\), then \(V_B-V_A\) equals

Two parallel resistanceless rails are connected by an inductor of inductance \(L\) at one end as shown. A uniform magnetic field \(B\) is inward, perpendicular to the plane of the rails. A conducting rod of length \(\ell\), mass \(m\) and negligible resistance is placed transversely on the rails and given an impulse \(J\) towards the right. Select the correct option(s) (refer to the figure for the exact expressions).
qOptions: Displacement of the conductor when its speed becomes half of the initial value is the expression marked (A) in the figure.
Displacement of the conductor when its speed becomes half of the initial value is the expression marked (B) in the figure.
Current through the inductor at the instant when the speed is half of the initial value is the expression marked (C) in the figure.
Current through the inductor at the instant when the speed is half of the initial value is the expression marked (D) in the figure.

questions.qText: In the LC circuit shown, initially the capacitor has charge \(Q_0\). At \(t=0\), the switch \(S\) is closed. Which statement(s) is/are correct?
qOptions: Maximum current through the inductor is \(\dfrac{2Q_0}{\sqrt{LC}}\).
Charge on the capacitor is zero at \(t=\pi\sqrt{LC}\).
Current through the inductor is zero at \(t=\dfrac{\pi}{2}\sqrt{LC}\).
Maximum magnetic energy that can be stored in the inductor is \(\dfrac{Q_0^{\,2}}{2C}\).

questions.qText: In the electrical network of Fig. 4.77, the key is placed on (1) for \(t<0\) until the capacitor gets fully charged. The key is placed on (2) at \(t=0\). The time when the energy in both the capacitor and the inductor is the same for the first time is

The maximum current in the inductor is

Potential difference across the capacitor \(3C\) when the current in the circuit is maximum is

The switch is first connected to position-1. When the charge on the capacitor becomes half its maximum possible value, the switch is moved to position-2. Find the current in resistor \(X_3\) just after shifting to position-2 (Fig. given; \(L=5\,\text{mH},\; C=2\,\mu\text{F},\; R=10\,\Omega,\; \xi=5\,\text{V}\)).

Two capacitors \(C_1=C_2=\dfrac{1}{\pi^2}\times10^{-2}\,\text{F}\) and an inductor \(L=2\times10^{-2}\,\text{H}\) are connected in series as shown. Initially each capacitor carries charge \(4\sqrt{3}\,\mu\text{C}\). At \(t=0\), switch \(S_1\) is closed and at \(t=1/400\,\text{s}\), switch \(S_2\) is also closed. In the circuit shown, initially \(k_1\) is closed and \(k_2\) is open. The capacitors \(C_1=2\,\mu\text{F}\) and \(C_2=3\,\mu\text{F}\) are connected to a \(20\,\text{V}\) source through \(R=20\,\Omega\).
Let \(k_1\) remain closed and \(k_2\) be opened for a long time. The charge on capacitor \(C_2\) will be

At \(t=0\), when the capacitors are fully charged, switch \(k_1\) is opened and \(k_2\) is closed so that the inductor \(L=2\,\text{H}\) is connected in series with capacitor \(C_1\). The maximum charge will appear on capacitor \(C_1\) at time \(t=\,?\)
The maximum energy across the inductor will be
A capacitor with charge \(Q\) is connected to an inductor \(L\) as shown. When the switch is flipped from position 1 to 2, the current in the circuit is observed to be half its maximum value. Then
qOptions: the charge on the capacitor at that instant was \(Q/2\)
the charge on the capacitor at that instant was \(\dfrac{\sqrt{3}}{2}Q\)

questions.qText: An alternating voltage of amplitude \(V_0=100\,\text{V}\) is applied across a capacitor and an inductor connected in parallel with reactances \(X_C=10\,\Omega\) and \(X_L=5\,\Omega\), respectively. The ratio of current through the inductor to the source current is

A uniform magnetic field \(B\) is directed into the page. The conductor is displaced to the right by \(x_0\) (compressing the spring) and released from rest (gravity neglected).
